cards.flavor:
"Though Serra has not been seen for twenty years, her gargoyles still watch over our city and punish the guilty."
—Gulsen, abbey matron

cards.name: Angel of Fury
cards.text:
Flying

cards.name: Angel of Light
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.flavor:
"Keep your chainmail, warrior. I have my own form of protection."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Armored Griffin
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.flavor:
"I would say that our bureaucrats are no better than vipers—but I shouldn't insult the vipers."
—Murat, death speaker
cards.name: Aysen Bureaucrats
cards.text: {T}: Tap target creature with power 2 or less.

cards.flavor:
"A renegade rallying the rabble does not a true crusader make."
—Irini Sengir
cards.name: Aysen Crusader
cards.text: Aysen Crusader's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Soldiers and Warriors you control.

cards.name: Caribou Range
cards.text:
Enchant land you control
Enchanted land has "{W}{W}, {T}: Put a 0/1 white Caribou creature token onto the battlefield."
Sacrifice a Caribou token: You gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"Without combat medics, Icatia would probably not have withstood the forces of chaos as long as it did."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI
cards.name: Combat Medic
cards.text: {1}{W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.flavor:
"I implore you not to forget the horrors of the past. You would have us start the Brothers' War anew!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic
cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Energy Storm
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by instant and sorcery spells.
Creatures with flying don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.flavor:
"May they speed to their task, for the skyknights alone cannot hold Kjeldor safe."
—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain
cards.name: Errand of Duty
cards.text: Put a 1/1 white Knight creature token with banding onto the battlefield. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.name: Farrel's Mantle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks and isn't blocked, its controller may have it deal damage equal to its power plus 2 to another target creature. If that player does, the attacking creature assigns no combat damage this turn.

cards.flavor: Farrel and his followers became a formidable band of vigilantes, battling Icatians and followers of Tourach.
cards.name: Farrel's Zealot
cards.text: Whenever Farrel's Zealot attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal 3 damage to target creature. If you do, Farrel's Zealot assigns no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Icatian Javelineers
cards.text:
Icatian Javelineers enters the battlefield with a javelin counter on it.
{T}, Remove a javelin counter from Icatian Javelineers: Icatian Javelineers deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Even after the wall was breached in half a dozen places, the phalanxes fought on, standing solidly against the onrushing raiders. Disciplined and dedicated, they held their ranks to the end, even in the face of tremendous losses.
cards.name: Icatian Phalanx
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.flavor:
"Because the orc hordes attacked along the entire border, Scouts were essential to Icatia's defense."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI
cards.name: Icatian Scout
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"More than lessons may be gained from the past."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.name: Inheritance
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {3}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Ivory Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying
When Ivory Gargoyle dies, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step and you skip your next draw step.
{4}{W}: Exile Ivory Gargoyle.

cards.flavor:
"In these troubled times, we alone carry the hope of reconciliation between Elf and Human."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Order advocate
cards.name: Juniper Order Advocate
cards.text: As long as Juniper Order Advocate is untapped, green creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: The winged helms of the guard are put on for pageants—but taken off for war.
cards.name: Kjeldoran Elite Guard
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Kjeldoran Elite Guard. Activate this ability only during combat.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Home Guard
cards.text: At end of combat, if Kjeldoran Home Guard attacked or blocked this combat, put a -0/-1 counter on Kjeldoran Home Guard and put a 0/1 white Deserter creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"If we do our duty and uphold our honor, Kjeldor shall stand for a thousand years."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight
cards.name: Kjeldoran Skycaptain
cards.text: Flying; first strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.flavor:
"Let us remember brave Jarkeld and his troops, who perished in the Adarkar Wastes so long ago."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.name: Lost Order of Jarkeld
cards.text:
As Lost Order of Jarkeld enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Lost Order of Jarkeld's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of creatures the chosen player controls.

cards.flavor: A blazing light to drive out the shadows.
cards.name: Order of the Sacred Torch
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.

cards.flavor:
"Shall we turn away a worthy soul because his parents were peasants? I think not."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield

cards.text:
Protection from black
{W}: Order of the White Shield gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}{W}: Order of the White Shield gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Thorn bushes spring up wherever the army has passed. Lean years follow in the wake of a great war."
—Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching, trans. Feng and English
cards.name: Ravages of War
cards.text: Destroy all lands.

cards.flavor:
"Let them send their legions! I will show them that my truth is stronger than their swords."
—General Varchild
cards.name: Reinforcements
cards.text: Put up to three target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.flavor:
"The meek shall fight as one, and they shall overcome even the greatest of foes."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.name: Reprisal
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Righteous Fury
cards.text: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.

cards.name: Royal Decree
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever a Swamp, Mountain, black permanent, or red permanent becomes tapped, Royal Decree deals 1 damage to that permanent's controller.

cards.flavor:
"Fortune does not side with the fainthearted."
—Sophocles, Phaedra
cards.name: Royal Trooper
cards.text: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Divine gifts are granted to those who are worthy."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.name: Sacred Boon
cards.text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.

cards.name: Scars of the Veteran
cards.text:
You may exile a white card from your hand rather than pay Scars of the Veteran's mana cost.
Prevent the next 7 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.

cards.flavor:
"You have almost completed your four years, my son. Soon you shall be a skyknight."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.flavor:
"Faith is our greatest protector."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.name: Sustaining Spirit
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

cards.flavor:
"The so-called barbarians will not respect us for our military might—they will respect us for our honor."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield
cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

cards.flavor:
"The folk of the Karplusan mountains are impossible to ambush."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.

cards.flavor:
"I do love the rain . . . but this storm feels somehow wrong, Taysir."

Creature spells can't be cast.

cards.flavor:
"The very lands of Balduvia are alive."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight
cards.name: Balduvian Conjurer
cards.text: {T}: Target snow land becomes a 2/2 creature until end of turn. It's still a land.

cards.flavor:
"What I want, I take."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage

Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Binding Grasp unless you pay {1}{U}.
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+1.

cards.flavor:
"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments, victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage
cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.

cards.flavor:
"Once great literature—now great litter."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
cards.name: Browse
cards.text: {2}{U}{U}: Look at the top five cards of your library, put one of them into your hand, and exile the rest.

cards.flavor:
"The duel was going badly for me, and Zur thought I was finished. He boasted that he would eat my soul—but all he ate were his words."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage
cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Deep Spawn
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Deep Spawn unless you put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
{U}: Deep Spawn gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Deep Spawn. (A creature with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Dreams of the Dead
cards.text: {1}{U}: Return target white or black creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains "Cumulative upkeep {2}." If the creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else. (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless he or she pays its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter, Kjeldoran royal mage
cards.name: Enervate
cards.text:
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.flavor: Never underestimate the power of the soul unleashed.
cards.name: Essence Flare
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -0/-1 counter on that creature.

cards.text:
Iceberg enters the battlefield with X ice counters on it.
{3}: Put an ice counter on Iceberg.
Remove an ice counter from Iceberg: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.text:
When Icy Prison enters the battlefield, exile target creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Icy Prison unless any player pays {3}.
When Icy Prison leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor:
"These sorcerers always seem to have another surprise up their sleeves."
—Zur the Enchanter

cards.text:
{T}, Discard a nonblack card: Draw a card.
{T}, Discard a black card: Draw two cards, then discard one of them.

"All the knowledge of Lat-Nam could not protect its sages from the Brothers' War."

cards.text: Shuffle a card from your hand into your library. If you do, draw two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.text:
Marjhan doesn't untap during your untap step.
{U}{U}, Sacrifice a creature: Untap Marjhan. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
Marjhan can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}{U}: Marjhan gets -1/-0 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to target attacking creature without flying.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Marjhan.

cards.flavor:
"Magic overused can freeze the mind. Creativity is more important than power."
—Zur the Enchanter

cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{T}: Put a music counter on target creature. If it doesn't have "At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy this creature unless you pay {1} for each music counter on it," it gains that ability.

cards.flavor:
"Who needs a spear? Ya break off the horn, and ya stab the fish with it. Easy!"
—Kakra, sea troll

cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature you control with toughness 2 or less gets +1/+1 and gains flying until end of turn. When Phantasmal Mount leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice that creature. When the creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Phantasmal Mount.

cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle his or her library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.

Flying

cards.flavor:
"It rose above our heads, above the ship, and still higher yet. No foggy, ice-laden sea in the world could frighten me more."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.name: Sea Spirit

cards.flavor:
"Capturing this specimen was not easy. Study it well, that you someday might be as versatile."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

Flying

Flying

cards.flavor: Doing something at the last minute isn't so bad when you can make that minute last.

cards.text:

Exile the top card of your library: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

Enchant creature you control
Whenever enchanted creature attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it assign no combat damage this turn. If you do, defending player discards a card at random.

cards.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Dance of the Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Dance of the Dead." Put enchanted creature card onto the battlefield tapped under your control and attach Dance of the Dead to it. When Dance of the Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {1}{B}. If he or she does, untap that creature.

cards.flavor:
"Will not the mountains quake and hills melt at the coming of the darkness? Share this vision with your enemies, Lim-Dûl, and they shall wither."
—Leshrac, Walker of Night

cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

"Take their dead, and entomb them in the snow. Risen, they shall serve a new purpose."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"Rarely have power and madness been so delightfully wed as they have in our dear grandmother."

—Baris, Serra inquisitor

—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield

"They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.text:
Protection from white
{B}: Knight of Stromgald gains first strike until end of turn.

Enchant creature

cards.name: Krovikan Horror

cards.name: Krovikan Vampire
cards.text: At the beginning of each end step, if a creature dealt damage by Krovikan Vampire this turn died, put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Sacrifice it when you lose control of Krovikan Vampire.

cards.flavor:

—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

cards.flavor:
"When you cannot rely on your sources, trust your own senses. When you cannot trust those, you must follow your instincts."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain
cards.name: Misinformation
cards.text: Put up to three target cards from an opponent's graveyard on top of his or her library in any order.

cards.flavor: Necrites killed Jherana Rure, ending the counterinsurgency.

cards.text: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Necropotence
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.

cards.name: Phantasmal Fiend
cards.text:
{B}: Phantasmal Fiend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Switch Phantasmal Fiend's power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.flavor:

—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic
cards.name: Ritual of the Machine
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Ritual of the Machine, sacrifice a creature.
Gain control of target nonartifact, nonblack creature.

cards.flavor: Not wind, but the breath of the dead.

cards.text: Add {B} to your mana pool for each creature card in your graveyard.

cards.text:

Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +2/+2 counter on that creature if the exiled creature was a Thrull.

Enchant creature

—Avram Garrisson, leader of the Knights of Stromgald

{B}: Withering Wisps deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. Activate this ability no more times each turn than the number of snow Swamps you control.

"Fair fight? I'll take survival over chivalry any day!"

cards.flavor:

—Jaya Ballard, task mage

cards.text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

cards.flavor:
"They aren't the brightest or the quickest of giants. For that matter, the same holds true if you compare them to rocks."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.name: Karplusan Giant
cards.text: Tap an untapped snow land you control: Karplusan Giant gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lava Burst
cards.text: Lava Burst deals X damage to target creature or player. If Lava Burst would deal damage to a creature, that damage can't be prevented or dealt instead to another creature or player.

cards.flavor:

—Jaya Ballard, task mage

cards.text: Meteor Shower deals X plus 1 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Mudslide
cards.text:
Creatures without flying don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped creatures without flying he or she controls and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

cards.flavor:
"Your army must fear you more than the enemy. Only then will you triumph."
—Malga Phlegmtooth

cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice another Orc or Goblin: Other Orc creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:

—Toothlicker Harj, orcish captain

cards.text:
Orcish Conscripts can't attack unless at least two other creatures attack.
Orcish Conscripts can't block unless at least two other creatures block.

cards.flavor:

—Toothlicker Harj, orcish captain

cards.text:

cards.flavor:

cards.flavor:
"As the climate cooled, many elves turned to thallid farming for food, while the hunters honed their skills on what little game remained."

cards.flavor:

cards.flavor:
"We are never without guidance, if we but seek it."

cards.flavor:

—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order

—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

cards.text: {G}{G}: Put a spore counter on target Fungus.

cards.flavor:

cards.flavor:

cards.flavor:

Whenever a player puts a Swamp or black permanent onto the battlefield, he or she sacrifices a Swamp or black permanent.

cards.flavor:

cards.text: You may have Wolf Pack assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

—Disa the Restless, journal entry

Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor:

—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter
cards.name: Yavimaya Ancients

cards.flavor:
"I have seen the true path. I will not warm myself by the fire—I will become the flame."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.flavor:

cards.name: Nature's Blessing
cards.text: {G}{W}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature or that creature gains banding, first strike, or trample. (This effect lasts indefinitely. Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.flavor:
"We were not meant to have such terrible things. They should be left where we found them, if not destroyed!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic
cards.name: Despotic Scepter
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target permanent you own. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Elkin Bottle
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Exile the top card of your library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card.

cards.flavor: Scholars are uncertain whether it was the actual sound or some other magical property of the elven lyre that transformed its player.
cards.name: Elven Lyre
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Elven Lyre: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Gustha's Scepter
cards.text:
{T}: Exile a card from your hand face down. You may look at it for as long as it remains exiled.
{T}: Return a card you own exiled with Gustha's Scepter to your hand.
When you lose control of Gustha's Scepter, put all cards exiled with Gustha's Scepter into their owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Helm of Obedience
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Target opponent puts cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard until a creature card or X cards are put into that graveyard this way, whichever comes first. If a creature card is put into that graveyard this way, sacrifice Helm of Obedience and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. X can't be 0.

cards.name: Jester's Mask
cards.text:
Jester's Mask enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Mask: Target opponent puts the cards from his or her hand on top of his or her library. Search that player's library for that many cards. That player puts those cards into his or her hand, then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Jeweled Amulet
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Jeweled Amulet. Note the type of mana spent to pay this activation cost. Activate this ability only if there are no charge counters on Jeweled Amulet.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Jeweled Amulet: Add one mana of Jeweled Amulet's last noted type to your mana pool.

cards.name: Lodestone Bauble
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Lodestone Bauble: Put up to four target basic land cards from a player's graveyard on top of his or her library in any order. That player draws a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Mana Crypt
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Mana Crypt deals 3 damage to you.
{T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: The very ground yielded to Mishra's wishes.
cards.name: Mishra's Groundbreaker
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Mishra's Groundbreaker: Target land becomes a 3/3 artifact creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.name: Phyrexian Devourer
cards.text:
When Phyrexian Devourer's power is 7 or greater, sacrifice it.
Exile the top card of your library: Put X +1/+1 counters on Phyrexian Devourer, where X is the exiled card's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Phyrexian Portal
cards.text: {3}: If your library has ten or more cards in it, target opponent looks at the top ten cards of your library and separates them into two face-down piles. Exile one of those piles. Search the other pile for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle the rest of that pile into your library.

cards.flavor:
"The roterothoper is as insidious as it is ingenious. It is one of the few creations of our school that I take no pride in."
—Baki, wizard attendant
cards.name: Roterothopter
cards.text:
Flying
{2}: Roterothopter gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.

cards.flavor:
"Let any who doubt the evil of using the ancient devices look at this infernal machine. What manner of fiend would design such a sadistic device?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic
cards.name: Skull Catapult
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Snow Fortress
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Snow Fortress gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{1}: Snow Fortress gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{3}: Snow Fortress deals 1 damage to target creature without flying that's attacking you.

cards.flavor:
"This ceaseless device has helped uncover marvels unreachable by mere flesh."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist
cards.name: Soldevi Digger
cards.text: {2}: Put the top card of your graveyard on the bottom of your library.

cards.flavor: They look human—until they bleed.
cards.name: Soldevi Simulacrum
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{1}: Soldevi Simulacrum gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Time Bomb
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a time counter on Time Bomb.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Time Bomb: Time Bomb deals damage equal to the number of time counters on it to each creature and each player.

cards.flavor:
"Direct confrontation never was to the orcs' taste."
—General Varchild
cards.name: Whirling Catapult
cards.text: {2}, Exile the top two cards of your library: Whirling Catapult deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player.

cards.name: Badlands
cards.text: ({T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Balduvian Trading Post
cards.text:
If Balduvian Trading Post would enter the battlefield, sacrifice an untapped Mountain instead. If you do, put Balduvian Trading Post onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {1}{R} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Balduvian Trading Post deals 1 damage to target attacking creature.

cards.name: Dwarven Ruins
cards.text:
Dwarven Ruins enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Dwarven Ruins: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Ebon Stronghold
cards.text:
Ebon Stronghold enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ebon Stronghold: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Glacial Chasm
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep—Pay 2 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When Glacial Chasm enters the battlefield, sacrifice a land.
Creatures you control can't attack.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.

cards.name: Havenwood Battleground
cards.text:
Havenwood Battleground enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Havenwood Battleground: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Heart of Yavimaya
cards.text:
If Heart of Yavimaya would enter the battlefield, sacrifice a Forest instead. If you do, put Heart of Yavimaya onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ice Floe
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Ice Floe during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature without flying that's attacking you. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Ice Floe remains tapped.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Outpost
cards.text:
If Kjeldoran Outpost would enter the battlefield, sacrifice a Plains instead. If you do, put Kjeldoran Outpost onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{1}{W}, {T}: Put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Ruins of Trokair
cards.text:
Ruins of Trokair enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ruins of Trokair: Add {W}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Savannah
cards.text: ({T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Soldevi Excavations
cards.text:
If Soldevi Excavations would enter the battlefield, sacrifice an untapped Island instead. If you do, put Soldevi Excavations onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {1}{U} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Svyelunite Temple
cards.text:
Svyelunite Temple enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Svyelunite Temple: Add {U}{U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Taiga
cards.text: ({T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Tundra
cards.text: ({T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Underground Sea
cards.text: ({T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.)
